# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Distributed

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String}}) 
    # Create the Distributed array
    distributed_strings = Distributed.DistributedArray{String}(strings))

    # Define the worker function for each element of the分布式 string array
    @worker for i in distributed_strings[i]
        string_to_pig_latin(string)
    end

end
```

This code defines a `pig_latinify` function that takes a vector of strings as input. 

Inside the `pig_latinify` function, we create a `Distributed.DistributedArray{String}(strings))` using ` Distributed.DistributedArray{String}(strings))` . This array will be used to distribute the computation across multiple threads.

Next, we define a worker function for each element of the distributed string array. Inside this function, we call the `string_to_pig_latin(string)`` inside it which will convert the input string to pig Latin.

Finally, in the main part of the code, we create a vector of strings and pass it to the `pig_latinify` function.
